title: References (Part 4)
content:
References

References (Part 4)

Continued References [51-63]

  • [51] Jie Huang and Kevin Chen-Chuan Chang - Towards reasoning in large language models: A survey (2022)
  • [52] Qiguang Chen et al. - Towards reasoning era: A survey of long chain-of-thought for reasoning (2025)
  • [53] Fengji Xu et al. - Towards large reasoning models: A survey of reinforced reasoning with large language models (2025)
  • [54] Zixuan Ke et al. - A survey of frontiers in LLM reasoning: Inference scaling, learning to reason, and agentic systems (2025)
  • [55] Kaiyan Zhang et al. - A survey of reinforcement learning for large reasoning models (2025)
  • [56] Guibin Zhang et al. - The landscape of agentic reinforcement learning for LLMs: A survey (2025)
  • [57] Minhua Lin et al. - A comprehensive survey on reinforcement learning-based agentic search (2025)
  • [58] Jinyuan Fang et al. - A comprehensive survey of self-evolving AI agents: On path to artificial super intelligence (2025)
  • [59] Huan-ang Gao et al. - A survey of self-evolving agents: On path to artificial super intelligence (2025)
  • [60] Daya Guo et al. - Deepseek-r1: Incentivizing reasoning capability in LLMs via reinforcement learning (2025)
  • [61] Pengcheng Jiang et al. - Deepretrieval: Hacking real search engines and retrievers with large language models via reinforcement learning (2025)
  • [62] John Schulman et al. - Proximal policy optimization algorithms (2017)
  • [63] Zhihong Shao et al. - Deepseekmath: Pushing the limits of mathematical reasoning in open language models (2024)

Analysis & Explanation

Survey and Review Papers

Core Themes
  • Reasoning Surveys: Comprehensive reviews of LLM reasoning
  • Reinforcement Learning: PPO and reward-based training
  • Self-Evolution: Agents that improve over time
  • Mathematical Reasoning: DeepSeek series advances
